argument.description: The data type into which to cast expression.
Optional integer expression that specifies how the TRY_CONVERT function is to translate expression.

returnType: Returns a value cast to the specified data type if the cast succeeds; otherwise, returns null.
description: Returns a value cast to the specified data type if the cast succeeds; otherwise, returns null.
sample:
SELECT   
    CASE WHEN TRY_CONVERT(float, 'test') IS NULL   
    THEN 'Cast failed'  
    ELSE 'Cast succeeded'  
END AS Result;  
GO
